qas.question: What was the root cause of the Brixton riot in 1981?
In what year was the Greater London Council formed?
In what period was London a symbol of trend-setting and youth?
During "The Troubles", who waged assaults via bombings on London?
Why was the Greater London Council established?

answers.text: the growth of the urban area

context: Primarily starting in <a2_0>the mid-1960s<a2_0/>, London became a centre for the worldwide youth culture, exemplified by the Swinging London subculture associated with the King's Road, Chelsea and Carnaby Street. The role of trendsetter was revived during the punk era. In <a1_0>1965<a1_0/> London's political boundaries were expanded to take into account <a4_0>the growth of the urban area<a4_0/> and a new Greater London Council was created. During The Troubles in Northern Ireland, London was subjected to bombing attacks by <a3_0>the Provisional IRA<a3_0/>. <a0_0>Racial inequality<a0_0/> was highlighted by the 1981 Brixton riot.
